summary: This is a legal motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team seeking to dismiss Counts Five and Six of the superseding indictment against her, arguing the alleged misstatements are not perjurious as a matter of law. The document is a notice of motion submitted to the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) who is moving to dismiss two perjury counts against her.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who signed and submitted the motion on behalf of the defense team.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Dismiss Perjury Counts
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files a motion to dismiss Counts Five and Six of the superseding indictment, arguing the alleged misstatements are not perjurious as a matter of law.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a motion to dismiss Counts Five and Six of the superseding indictment against her.
The motion argues that the alleged misstatements forming the basis of the perjury charges are 'not perjurious as a matter of law'.
The document reveals Maxwell had a substantial legal defense team with attorneys from multiple law firms in different states.
The case is identified as United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, case number 20 Cr. 330 (MN).
The motion was filed on January 25, 2021, indicating ongoing pretrial proceedings in Maxwell's criminal case.
